metadata.description: Essential daily life verbs - reflexive verbs and common actions

present.spanish: Te sientas en el sillón más cómodo de la casa.
present.english: You sit in the most comfortable chair in the house.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Te sientas siempre en el mismo lugar del café.
present.english: You (informal) always sit in the same spot at the café.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te sientas en la sala para tomar tu café.
present.english: You sit in the living room to drink your coffee.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Siempre te sientas en la misma mesa para estudiar.
present.english: You always sit at the same table to study.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te sientas un rato después de llegar a casa.
present.english: You sit down for a bit after getting home.
present.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Me senté en la sala de espera durante dos horas.
preterite.english: I sat in the waiting room for two hours.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se sentó a reflexionar sobre su futuro.
preterite.english: He sat down to reflect on his future.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Nos sentaremos a discutir el trabajo mañana.
future.english: We will sit down to discuss the work tomorrow.
future.subject: nosotros

future.spanish: Me sentaré a estudiar después de cenar.
future.english: I will sit down to study after dinner.
future.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te acuestas después de ver las noticias.
present.english: You go to bed after watching the news.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Nos acostamos después de leer un rato.
present.english: We go to bed after reading for a while.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Te acuestas temprano los lunes porque trabajas temprano.
present.english: You go to bed early on Mondays because you work early.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Normalmente te acuestas viendo videos en tu teléfono.
present.english: You usually go to bed watching videos on your phone.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te acuestas tarde cuando hace mucho calor.
present.english: You go to bed late when it's really hot.
present.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Me acosté muy tarde porque tenía mucho trabajo.
preterite.english: I went to bed very late because I had a lot of work.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te acostaste temprano para estar fresco mañana.
preterite.english: You went to bed early to feel rested tomorrow.
preterite.subject: vos

quality.fix_issue: English translation slightly unnatural ('to be fresh tomorrow')

future.spanish: Me acostaré más temprano a partir de mañana.
future.english: I will go to bed earlier starting tomorrow.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te acostarás cuando termines la tarea.
future.english: You (informal) will go to bed when you (informal) finish your homework.
future.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Los niños se van a acostar temprano.
going-to.english: The children are going to go to bed early.
going-to.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: La jefa despierta a los estudiantes temprano.
present.english: The boss wakes the students up early.

present.spanish: Me despierto a las seis de la mañana todos los días.
present.english: I wake up at six in the morning every day.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te despiertas a las seis todos los días.
present.english: You wake up at six every day.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te despiertas con el sonido de tu alarma, aunque no quieras.
present.english: You wake up with your alarm, even if you don't want to.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te despiertas temprano incluso los fines de semana.
present.english: You wake up early even on weekends.
present.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Me desperté sobresaltado por el ruido.
preterite.english: I woke up startled by the noise.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se despertó en el hospital sin recordar nada.
preterite.english: He woke up in the hospital remembering nothing.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Te despertarás en tu nueva casa mañana.
future.english: You will wake up in your new house tomorrow.
future.subject: vos

future.spanish: Me despertaré más temprano para hacer ejercicio.
future.english: I will wake up earlier to exercise.
future.subject: yo

present.spanish: Me visto elegante para ir al trabajo.
present.english: I dress elegantly to go to work.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te vistes siempre con colores alegres.
present.english: You always dress in cheerful colors.
present.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Me vestí rápidamente para no llegar tarde.
preterite.english: I got dressed quickly so as not to be late.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se vistió de negro para el funeral.
preterite.english: He dressed in black for the funeral.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Te vestirás como un trabajador en tu nuevo trabajo.
future.english: You (informal) will dress like a worker in your new job.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Me vestiré de azul para la boda.
future.english: I will dress in blue for the wedding.
future.subject: yo

present.spanish: Me levanto a las seis de la mañana.
present.english: I get up at six in the morning.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te levantas con mucha energía cada día.
present.english: You wake up with lots of energy every day.
present.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Me levanté muy temprano para ver el amanecer.
preterite.english: I got up very early to see the sunrise.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te levantaste con mucha energía después de las vacaciones.
preterite.english: You (informal) got up with lots of energy after vacation.
preterite.subject: tú

future.spanish: Me levantaré más temprano a partir de mañana.
future.english: I will get up earlier starting tomorrow.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te levantarás con el canto de los gallos en el campo.
future.english: You (informal) will get up with the rooster's crow in the countryside.
future.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Me voy a levantar temprano mañana.
going-to.english: I'm going to get up early tomorrow.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.english: Are you going to get up late?
going-to.subject: tú

present.spanish: Encuentras trabajo fácilmente con tu experiencia.
present.english: You find work easily with your experience.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Encuentra tiempo para leer todos los días.
present.english: He finds time to read every day.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Encontró trabajo en una empresa multinacional.
preterite.english: He found work at a multinational company.
preterite.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Encontró trabajo en una empresa multinacional.
preterite.english: She found work at a multinational company.
preterite.subject: ella

future.spanish: Encontrarán nuevos amigos en la escuela.
future.english: You all will find new friends at school.
future.subject: vosotros

future.spanish: Encontraremos una casa perfecta para la familia.
future.english: We will find a perfect house for the family.
future.subject: nosotros

going-to.english: We're going to find a solution.
going-to.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Lavo los platos después de cada comida.
present.english: I wash the dishes after every meal.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Lava las ventanas de la casa cada mes.
present.english: He washes the house windows every month.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Lavé toda la ropa sucia el domingo pasado.
preterite.english: I washed all the dirty clothes last Sunday.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Lavó la ropa de bebé con detergente especial.
preterite.english: He washed the baby clothes with special detergent.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Lavarán las herramientas después de terminar el trabajo.
future.english: They will wash the tools after finishing the work.
future.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Lavaremos toda la casa antes de la mudanza.
future.english: We will wash the entire house before moving.
future.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Ve a sus amigos cada fin de semana.
present.english: He sees his friends every weekend.
present.subject: él

present.spanish: Ve a sus amigos cada fin de semana.
present.english: She sees her friends every weekend.
present.subject: ella

preterite.spanish: Vi una película increíble anoche en el cine.
preterite.english: I saw an incredible movie last night at the cinema.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Vieron fuegos artificiales desde el balcón.
preterite.english: They saw fireworks from the balcony.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Verás que tenía razón sobre el trabajo.
future.english: You will see that I was right about the work.
future.subject: vos

future.spanish: Veré a mis padres el próximo fin de semana.
future.english: I will see my parents next weekend.
future.subject: yo

going-to.english: We're going to watch a movie.
going-to.subject: nosotros

going-to.spanish: Vas a ver que todo sale bien.
going-to.english: You're going to see that everything turns out fine.
going-to.subject: tú

present.spanish: Das muy buenos consejos a tus amigos.
present.english: You (informal) give very good advice to your friends.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Das lo mejor de ti en cada trabajo.
present.english: You give your best in every job.
present.subject: vos

quality.fix_issue: 'vos' form is Rioplatense; English translation slightly off

preterite.spanish: Di mi opinión honesta sobre el trabajo.
preterite.english: I gave my honest opinion about the work.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Diste una excelente presentación ayer.
preterite.english: You (informal) gave an excellent presentation yesterday.
preterite.subject: tú

future.spanish: Daré lo mejor de mí en el nuevo trabajo.
future.english: I will give my best in the new job.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Darás una conferencia sobre tu estudio.
future.english: You (informal) will give a lecture about your study.
future.subject: tú

going-to.english: I'm going to give a presentation.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.english: They're going to throw a party.
going-to.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Dices exactamente lo que piensas.
present.english: You say exactly what you think.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Dice que viene mañana por la tarde.
present.english: He says he/she's coming tomorrow afternoon.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Dijeron que el trabajo era imposible.
preterite.english: They said the work was impossible.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Dije exactamente lo que pensaba sobre la situación.
preterite.english: I said exactly what I thought about the situation.
preterite.subject: yo

future.spanish: Diré mi opinión en la próxima clase.
future.english: I will say my opinion in the next class.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Dirás unas palabras en la ceremonia de graduación.
future.english: You (informal) will say a few words at the graduation ceremony.
future.subject: tú

going-to.english: What are you going to tell him/her?
going-to.subject: tú

going-to.english: I'm going to tell the truth.
going-to.subject: yo

present.spanish: Mis jefes saben que en ese restaurante preparan pizza muy buena.
present.english: My bosses know that they make very good pizza at that restaurant.

quality.fix_issue: Wrong possessive ('Mi jefes'), 'saber/conocer' confusion; needs translation

preterite.spanish: Supe la noticia por casualidad en el café.
preterite.english: I found out the news by chance at the café.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Supiste manejar la situación muy bien.
preterite.english: You (informal) knew how to handle the situation very well.
preterite.subject: tú

future.spanish: Sabré la respuesta después de investigar más.
future.english: I will know the answer after studying more.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Sabrás tocar el piano como un profesional.
future.english: You will know how to play the piano like a professional.
future.subject: tú

quality.fix_issue: Meaning unnatural ('play piano like a worker')

going-to.spanish: Vas a saber la respuesta pronto.
going-to.english: You're going to know the answer soon.
going-to.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: Vamos a saber los resultados mañana.
going-to.english: We're going to know the results tomorrow.
going-to.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: ¿Cómo se llama el profesor? ¿Jorge?
present.english: What is the professor's name? Jorge?

present.spanish: Me llamo Ana y soy de México.
present.english: My name is Ana and I'm from Mexico.
present.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Me reporté enfermo y no fui a trabajar.
preterite.english: I called in sick and didn't go to work.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te dijiste valiente después de saltar.
preterite.english: You called yourself brave after jumping.
preterite.subject: tú

quality.fix_issue: llamarse does NOT mean 'call yourself' in this sense

future.spanish: Seré doctora cuando termine la carrera.
future.english: I will call myself doctor when I finish my degree.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Llamarás todos los días desde Europa.
future.english: You will call every day from Europe.
future.subject: tú

quality.fix_issue: Using llamarse instead of llamar ('to call')

present-progressive.spanish: Me llamo Ana y soy de México.
present-progressive.english: My name is Ana and I'm from Mexico.
present-progressive.subject: yo

present-progressive.spanish: Te llamas igual que tu abuelo.
present-progressive.subject: tú

going-to.spanish: El bebé se va a llamar Diego.
going-to.english: The baby is going to be named Diego.
going-to.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Te duchas antes de ir al trabajo, ¿verdad?
present.english: You shower before going to work, right?
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Siempre te duchas rápido cuando tienes prisa.
present.english: You always shower quickly when you're in a hurry.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te duchas en la noche para relajarte.
present.english: You shower at night to relax.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te lavas las manos antes de comer.
present.english: You wash your hands before eating.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Siempre te lavas la cara al levantarte.
present.english: You always wash your face when you get up.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te lavas los dientes después del desayuno.
present.english: You brush your teeth after breakfast.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: El vuelo sale a las tres y media.
present.english: The flight leaves at three-thirty.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: La reunión empieza a las ocho en punto.
present.english: The meeting starts at eight sharp.
present.subject: él/ella/usted
